questions.text: Which front-end framework or library do you use most frequently in your projects?
How important do you consider user experience (UX) design principles when developing the front-end of a web application?
options: Not very important, functionality takes priority.
Somewhat important, but I primarily focus on code quality.
Very important, I strive to create a seamless and intuitive user experience.
Essential, UX design is an integral part of the front-end development process.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes your approach to writing clean and maintainable front-end code?
options: I prioritize functionality and get the job done quickly.
I follow basic coding conventions for readability.
I utilize modular code structure and best practices for maintainability.
I write highly-commented and well-documented code for future reference.

questions.text: How often do you stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in front-end development tools and technologies?
options: Rarely, I focus on the tools I already know well.
Occasionally, when I encounter a specific project requirement.
Regularly, I follow industry publications and attend workshops.
Constantly, I actively seek out new learning opportunities and experiment with emerging technologies.

questions.text: Beyond the core languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), describe a development workflow or approach that you find particularly efficient or effective. Why does it work well for you?
In your experience, what are the biggest challenges in creating a truly responsive web experience that caters to various devices and screen sizes?

The concept of progressive enhancement is a core principle in front-end development. How do you balance building a functional baseline experience with incorporating advanced features for users with better browsing capabilities?
